title: The Tabernacle is Set Up and Filled with God’s Glory
summary: Exodus 40 concludes the book with Moses setting up the tabernacle. After anointing and consecrating it and the priests, the glory of the Lord fills the tabernacle, showing that God’s presence is now dwelling among His people.

faq.question: What happened when the tabernacle was finished?
faq.answer: God’s glory filled it, and a cloud rested over it as a visible sign of His presence.

faq.question: How did the Israelites know when to travel?
faq.answer: When the cloud lifted, they set out; when it stayed, they remained in place.
